intro: Stylidium lepidum, commonly known as the silverleaf triggerplant, is a small flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its unique, spurred petals that are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. Its leaves are covered in a fine layer of white wax, giving it a silvery appearance. Stylidium lepidum is a member of the family Haemodoraceae and is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid regions.
